fullText: Bryan Cranston gives a powerhouse performance as the mad prophet of the airwaves in this electrifying adaptation of Paddy Chayefsky's prescient 1976 satire.
dtliExcerpt: Bryan Cranston gives a powerhouse performance as the mad prophet of the airwaves in this electrifying adaptation of Paddy Chayefsky's prescient 1976 satire.
bwwExcerpt: Bryan Cranston, who could do no wrong as Walter White in 'Breaking Bad' (and a Tony winner for 'All the Way'), burrows deep under the skin of Howard Beale here: the furrowed brow, the anxious angularity, the searching eyes all indicate a person in extremis. But it's the voice that really makes us feel - and fear - for Beale. Beneath the mellifluous tones of Cranston's professional 'newsman' delivery we can hear the agitated rasp and incipient howl of a person who's cracking up.
showScoreExcerpt: Bryan Cranston gives a powerhouse performance as the mad prophet of the airwaves in this electrifying adaptation of Paddy Chayefsky's prescient 1976 satire.
